required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mycophenolate Mofetil Versus Cyclosporin A in the Treatment of Primary Biliary Cholangitis-autoimmune Hepatitis Overlap Syndrome Due to Nonresponse to Standard Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Mycophenolate Mofetil Versus Cyclosporin A in the Treatment of Primary Biliary Cholangitis-autoimmune Hepatitis Overlap Syndrome Duo to Nonresponse to Standard Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: Biochemical response of primary biliary cholangitis-autoimmune hepatitis overlap syndrome induced by mycophenolate mofetil versus cyclosporin A

primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients in biochemical remission, defined as normalization of serum ALT and IgG levels after 24 weeks of treatment, per treatment group.

secondary_outcome.description: Partial remission, defined as alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) serum levels >1x Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) and <2x ULN
Minimal response, defined as decrease of ALT or AST serum levels but still >2x ULN
defined as no improvement or increase of ALT or AST serum levels
liver stiffness will be measured by shear-wave elastography

intervention.description: Ursodeoxycholic acid combination of immunosuppressive agents(methylprednisolone with cyclosporin A)
Ursodeoxycholic acid combination of immunosuppressive agents(methylprednisolone with mycophenolate mofetil )
